question_text: Brun's nystagmus localizes to the cerebellopontine angle (CPA) and is most commonly indicative of what?

options.A: Schwannoma

options.A: Anterior chiasm

question_text: In Foster Kennedy syndrome with right optic atrophy, where is the lesion located?

options.A: Right frontal mass

options.A: Convergence-retraction nystagmus

options.A: No latency

question_text: Central nystagmus vs peripheral nystagmus will exhibit which of the following characteristics?

options.A: Torsional horizontal

question_text: Which of the following structures is most likely to be abnormal on VRE in a patient with oscillopsia?

options.A: Left inferior cerebellar peduncle

question_text: Between the optic tract and the visual cortex, which structure is located?

options.A: Lateral geniculate body

question_text: Prosopagnosia is primarily associated with which brain region?

options.A: Temporo-occipital gyrus

options.A: Temporal
